alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Campbell; Morgan; Roane (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 05 at 6:17AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Anderson, Campbell, Morgan and Roane. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 716 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to showers during the past one to three hours. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible over the area during the next few hours. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Oak Ridge, Clinton, Oliver Springs, Harriman, Caryville, Rocky Top, Norris, Oakdale, Rosedale, Petros, Coalfield, Disney, Dearmond, Frozen Head State Park, Norris Dam State Park and Andersonville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
